item.title: A 360° View of User Retention (ft. Appcues, Amplitude and Customer.io)
item.description:
A 360° View of User Retention (ft. Appcues, Amplitude and Customer.io)

Today we're going to look at user retention strategies across product, analytics and email-three tools that you can use together to keep users coming back for more. We'll hear from 3 retention experts: First is Jackson Noel.

item.title: 51 best online marketing resources and automation tools to boost your productivity
item.description:
51 best online marketing resources and automation tools to boost your productivity

Internet marketing success depends on its perfect execution! Your planning must have an execution which will be- So how do you do it? A battle is not won buy brawls but brains instead!

item.title: Collection of pitch decks from venture capital funded startups
item.description:
Collection of pitch decks from venture capital funded startups

You need to raise some money for your awesome startup, only you need a pesky pitch deck to show venture capitalists (VC) and you don't know what one looks like? It's not all that easy to get access to pitch decks, so I have done the work for you.

item.title: Alexander Jarvis Startup and Venture Capital
item.description:
Alexander Jarvis Startup and Venture Capital

Venture capital and startup in South East Asia and Europe including topics on fundraising, pitching, strategy and other important topics to founders.

item.title: Rebump
item.description:
Rebump

Rebump sends multiple follow-up messages to your email recipients for you. These automated emails are customized to appear as if you sent the email yourself. You can track and analyze all of your follow-up emails with your Rebump account. Simply install the Rebump extension to your browser.

item.title: How To Successfully Use Blog Commenting to Acquire New Users
item.description:
How To Successfully Use Blog Commenting to Acquire New Users

In the early days of Twoodo (not so long ago), we had little money to spend on acquiring new users but a huge need for users to visit, sign-up and test the first version of our website. Sounds familiar, doesn't it? We read about a cool growth hack involving "commenting on blog posts" recommended by several websites.

item.title: How to Turn Your Best Customers Into Your Best Salespeople
item.description:
How to Turn Your Best Customers Into Your Best Salespeople

It's never been easier to launch an ecommerce business than it is today. There are more tools, blog posts, and resources available to aspiring ecommerce entrepreneurs and business owners looking to connect with online customers than ever before.

item.title: Tomorrow's Buildings: Help! My building has been hacked - BBC News
item.description:
Tomorrow's Buildings: Help! My building has been hacked - BBC News

In 2013, Google - one of the world's pre-eminent tech companies - was hacked. It wasn't its search engine that was attacked or its advertising platform or even its social network, Google+. Instead, it was a building. Two cybersecurity experts hacked into its Wharf 7 office in Sydney, Australia, through Google's building management system (BMS).

item.title: The beginner's guide to Google Adwords - WP Curve
item.description:
The beginner's guide to Google Adwords - WP Curve

This is a (freaken awesome) guest post by Alex Fredheim. His course for small businesses provides a video walkthrough of exactly how to get new customers and sales with Adwords. Click here to learn more. Dan's intro: Adwords is such a huge part of small business marketing that I really wanted to help people out with it.
